result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason William Blank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Request for loss of good time and Order
12 days of good time lost
Note:  2016CT34 is incorrect case number on document- correct case number is 15CT34

Defendant Jason William Blank in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Jason William Blank in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  INIT 16 CF 267 - PLEAS on 16 TR 1305 - 16 CF 245 - SEHR on 15 CM 162, 15 CM 313 and 15 CT 34.  
State recites agreement for the SEHR 6 months county jail concurrent to each other  -in count 2 15 Cm 313 30 days  with 58 days credit as to time served

Court:  15 CM 162: 6 months county jail credit 58 days time served with huber - costs as previously ordered converted to civil judgment
15 CM 313 ct 1:  6 months county jail concurrent to 15 Cm 162, count 2 and 15 CT 34 credit for 58 days time served with huber- costs as previously ordered converted to civil judgment
Count 2: 30 days county jail concurrent to 15 Cm 162, count 1 15 CM 313 and 15 CT 34 - costs converted to civil judgment
15 CT 34: 6 months county jail concurrent with 15 CM 162, 15 CM 313 credit 58 days time served with huber - costs as previously ordered converted to civil judgment

Atty McL addressed the Court - acknowledged receipt of complaint in 16 CF 267.  Court advised defendant as to his right to have a preliminary exam.  DE wished to waive prelim in 16 CF 267.  Court finds DE has freely waived his right to prelim - finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Informations have been tendered to the Court.  Atty McL acknowledged receipt of infomations waived reading.  State recites agreement in felony files - 16cf 245 count 1 - sentence w/held probation 4 years - 1 yr county jail concurrent to 15 CM 162, 15 CM 313 and 15 CT 34 - AODA - any counseling DOC may impose - $2502.00 - 4 yr revocation of DL - and IID for 4 years and counts 2 thru 4 are dismissed and read-in along with 16 tr 1305 / 16 CF 267 - Sentence w/held probation 2 years  - any counseling DOC may impose - AODA - Fine/Costs $540.60     DE entered pleas of NC.     DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds DE guilty of count 1 in 16 CF 245 and 16 CF 267.

Court - 16 CF 245:  Sentence w/held probation 4 years - 1 year county jail concurrent with 15 CM 162, 15 CM 313 and 15 CT 34 with huber  Good time and 58 days credit time served  - AODA with VIP- any counseling DOC may impose - $2502.00 - 4 yr revocation of DL plus 1 year - and IID for 4 years effective 45 days from today and counts 2 thru 4 are dismissed and read-in along with 16 tr 1305 

16 CF 267:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years - fine/costs $540.60 - AODA - any counseling DOC may impose
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 6, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Restitution Information

Defendant Jason William Blank in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State gives plea agreement. DEF in agreement.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts
DEF pleads NC. Court addresses DEF, finds guilty. 
State argues sentence. DEF argues sentence. DEF addresses court.
Court address DEF. Imposes withheld sentence, places on probation for 2 years, concurrent to cases 15CT34 and 15CM313. Conditions of probation: payment of fines/costs, $589.00; complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent;  restitution in the amount of $ 185.00 pyable to Thomas Kintzinger.   DEF to report to S.O. today for DNA. Def. to report to Probation & Parole today. Credit for 3 days time served.
Defendant Jason William Blank in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes stmt.

Defendant Jason William Blank in court- allowed to appear by phone today, with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has not been reached.  Jury trial to be scheduled for case 15CM175, with 15CM313, 15CT34 & 15CM162 tracking with.  Atty Larimore to contact Judicial Assistant to schedule jury trial date.
Court states the DE must appear in person for all future court dates.

Defendant Jason William Blank in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties do not have agreement.  DEF requests trial date for 15CM313.  This case tracks with.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Atty Larimore no resolution at this time requests another status.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
